events.description: The ITE UNLV Student Chapter is hosting a Resume Review Workshop where students can get direct feedback from hiring managers and industry professionals to strengthen their resumes for internships and full-time opportunities.
Participants will explore the LeaderShape Model of Resilience to discover their core values, learn to navigate challenges, and build strength both individually and within communities.
K-pop Club is holding auditions to create a dance team where participants will present 30-60 seconds of any K-pop choreography and have a brief interview with judges.

events.eventName: Relaxing Your Mind: Coping With Anxiety
events.description: This two-part workshop provides information about anxiety and practical coping skills for managing anxiety and stress.
Join Dr. David Jeffrey as he explores the fascinating history of cosmology and how physicists study supernovae and radiative transfer to understand how the universe became what it is today.
Learn why it's important to schedule advising appointments early and how to make the most of these sessions, including strategies for selecting courses that align with your goals.
Join Rebel Freestyle to hone balance, coordination, dexterity, power, and friendships while meeting in the lobby of the Recreation Center.
Join Engineers Without Borders for their February project update meeting via Discord to discuss major club updates and progress with professionals in attendance.

events.eventName: Guided Hike with a Bureau of Land Management Ranger at Sloan Canyon Petroglyph Site
events.description: Join The Wildlife Society for a guided 5.5-mile hike on the Petroglyph Trail in Sloan Canyon National Conservation Area to learn about Mojave Desert plants, wildlife, and local history from a Park Ranger.
Unwind with Scientista over a latte and some treats at Tous Les Jours Cafe for a relaxing social gathering.
Join UNLV Birding and Conservation Club for a monthly on-campus bird walk to learn about birds and diversity right on UNLV's main campus, perfect for beginners and experienced birders.

events.eventName: It's Just Coffee: Mental Health in America
events.description: This event brings together diverse perspectives to dialogue about mental health in America through sharing viewpoints, listening openly, and working to understand each other in a low-stakes environment.
Join the Writing Center in collaboration with the Center for Academic Enrichment and Outreach to prepare for writing scholarship application essays.

events.eventName: UNLV PAD x Princeton Review: LSAT Reading Comprehension Workshop
events.description: Join an expert instructor to work through sample LSAT Reading Comprehension questions that will help prepare you for one of the two main LSAT sections.
This mini conference features interactive sessions centering Black LGBTQIA+ identity, Black mental health, resilience, and belonging through learning, healing, and affirmation.
This interactive session walks you through common workplace conflicts and provides techniques to resolve conflicts productively with peers, supervisors, or subordinates.
A calming space to slow down, breathe, and express yourself through soothing arts and crafts for mindfulness and relaxation.
Join for weekly guided meditation sessions to practice mindfulness and relaxation techniques.

events.eventName: Word Games Japanese Student Alliance General Meeting
events.description: Join the Japanese Students Alliance for Word Wolf and E-Shiritori games - knowledge of Japanese is not required as all games are available in English or Japanese.

events.eventName: ALPFA x Eide Bailly Early Career Panel
events.description: Join ALPFA for an early career panel with Eide Bailly professionals to gain insight into internships, full-time roles, and career growth in accounting and business.
